required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Trendelenburg Position on CCA Blood Flow
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Anesthesia, Pneumoperitoneum, and Patient Position on Common Carotid Artery Blood Flow During Laparoscopic Gynecology Operation

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will evaluate the change of the common carotid artery blood flow according to patient's position and penumoperitoneum.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will include 20 patients undergoing gynecological surgery. The common carotid artery blood flow will be measured using Doppler US during the following conditions; supine position before induction of anesthesia, supine position immediately after induction of anesthesia, supine position with penumoperitoneum, head-down position with or without pneumoperitoneum.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of the common carotid artery blood flow velocity
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1) baseline, 2) Immediately after induction of anesthesia, 3) immediately after pneumoperitoneum, 4) immediately after Trendelenburg position with penumoperitoneum, 5) Immediately after desufflation in Trendelenburg position
primary_outcome.description: Common carotid artery blood flow velocity is measured using Doppler US

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the common carotid artery beat volume
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) baseline, 2) Immediately after induction of anesthesia, 3) immediately after pneumoperitoneum, 4) immediately after Trendelenburg position with penumoperitoneum, 5) Immediately after desufflation in Trendelenburg position
secondary_outcome.description: Common carotid artery beat volume was calculated from median common carotid artery beat velocity and vessel diameter

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the common carotid artery diameter
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) baseline, 2) Immediately after induction of anesthesia, 3) immediately after pneumoperitoneum, 4) immediately after Trendelenburg position with penumoperitoneum, 5) Immediately after desufflation in Trendelenburg position
secondary_outcome.description: Common carotid artery diameter is obtained using US

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of mean arterial blood pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) baseline, 2) Immediately after induction of anesthesia, 3) immediately after pneumoperitoneum, 4) immediately after Trendelenburg position with penumoperitoneum, 5) Immediately after desufflation in Trendelenburg position
secondary_outcome.description: Mean arterial pressure is obtained concurrently with common carotid artery blood flow velocity measurements

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) baseline, 2) Immediately after induction of anesthesia, 3) immediately after pneumoperitoneum, 4) immediately after Trendelenburg position with penumoperitoneum, 5) Immediately after desufflation in Trendelenburg position
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiac output was obtained using FloTrac(EdwardLifescience, USA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of peak inspiration airway pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) baseline, 2) Immediately after induction of anesthesia, 3) immediately after pneumoperitoneum, 4) immediately after Trendelenburg position with penumoperitoneum, 5) Immediately after desufflation in Trendelenburg position
secondary_outcome.description: Peak inspiratory airway pressure is obtained using the ventilator system

study_pop.textblock: patients undergoing gynecology surgery under trendelenburg position

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA class I,II
- patients undergoing gynecology surgery under trendelenburg position
- Age ranges from 20 to 70
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI > 32
- Pregnancy
- Patients who did not agree to study
- Patients with allergies to the drugs used in this study
- Patients with anatomical variations or lesions in cervical or cranial vascular portion
- Patients with arrhythmia that may alter patient's cardiac output(e.g. artrial fibrillation)
